headline.print_headline: Corporate Money Allowed For Inaugural Donations
headline.seo: Obama to Accept Corporate Donations for 2013 Inaugural Events
headline.main: Corporate Money Allowed for Inaugural Donations

docs.snippet: President Obama’s 2013 inauguration will be low-key, compared with 2009’s festivities, but this year corporate donations, with some exceptions, will be welcome....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama's inaugural committee says his 2013 inaugural festivities will be low-key, compared to 2009, and that he will accept unlimited donations from corporations — but no money from lobbyists or political action committees — to finance events.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s 2013 inauguration will be low-key, compared with 2009’s festivities, but this year corporate donations, with some exceptions, will be welcome.

headline.print_headline: Gardner and Yankees Reach a Deal
headline.main: Gardner and Yankees Reach a Deal

docs.snippet: Outfielder Brett Gardner and the Yankees agreed to a one-year, $2.85 million contract....
docs.abstract: New York Yankees and outfielder Brett Gardner agree to a one-year, $2.85 million contract; other MLB developments noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Outfielder Brett Gardner and the Yankees agreed to a one-year, $2.85 million contract.

headline.print_headline: A Killer Ends Half-Told Tale Of His Crimes With Suicide
headline.seo: In Alaska, a Killer Ends Half-Told Tale of His Crimes With Suicide
headline.main: A Killer Ends Half-Told Tale of His Crimes With Suicide

docs.snippet: Investigators are now trying desperately to illuminate the dark shadows left by Israel Keyes, the admitted killer in Anchorage who took his own life last weekend....
docs.abstract: Law enforcement investigators are trying desperately to trace murderous path left by Israel Keyes, admitted killer in Anchorage who took his own life in jail after giving them partial details about rapes, serial murders, arson attacks and bank robberies he committed; police are appealing to public across the country for help in solving his crimes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investigators are now trying desperately to illuminate the dark shadows left by Israel Keyes, the admitted killer in Anchorage who took his own life last weekend.

headline.print_headline: Rebel Groups In Syria Make Framework For Military
headline.main: Rebel Groups in Syria Make Framework for Military

docs.snippet: After three days of intensive talks, military commanders of the main Free Syrian Army units from all over Syria agreed Friday to a unified command structure....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Military commanders of main Free Syrian Army units from all over Syria agree to unified command structure, product of three days of intensive talks among more than 260 rebel commanders.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and HWAIDA SAAD

docs.lead_paragraph: After three days of intensive talks, military commanders of the main Free Syrian Army units from all over Syria agreed Friday to a unified command structure.

headline.main: Maze Widens Cup Lead With a Sweep; Vonn Fails to Finish

docs.snippet: Tina Maze of Slovenia won her third race of the season by finishing first in both runs of a World Cup super-combined event Friday as American Lindsey Vonn failed to finish....
docs.abstract: Slovenian skier Tina Maze widens her World Cup lead by finishing first in both runs of World Cup super-combined event in St Mortiz, Switzerland.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tina Maze of Slovenia won her third race of the season by finishing first in both runs of a World Cup super-combined event Friday as American Lindsey Vonn failed to finish.

headline.print_headline: California: Autopsy Released In Killing of Notorious B.I.G.
headline.main: California: Autopsy Released in Killing of Notorious B.I.G.

docs.snippet: The rap artist Notorious B.I.G. was killed by a single bullet that pierced several vital organs in a 1997 drive-by shooting, a long-sealed autopsy report released on Friday shows....
docs.abstract: Long-sealed autopsy report relating to death of rap artist Christopher G Wallace, aka Notorious B I G, is released; report shows he was killed by single bullet that pierced several vital organs in 1997 drive-by shooting.
docs.lead_paragraph: The rap artist Notorious B.I.G. was killed by a single bullet that pierced several vital organs in a 1997 drive-by shooting, a long-sealed autopsy report released on Friday shows.

headline.seo: Air Force Orders Inspections of Facilities for Pornographic Material

docs.snippet: The Air Force has ordered inspections of its facilities for public displays of pornographic or misogynistic materials after complaints from female personnel....

docs.abstract: Air Force orders inspections of its facilities for public displays of pornographic or misogynistic materials after complaints from female personnel.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Air Force has ordered inspections of its facilities for public displays of pornographic or misogynistic materials after complaints from female personnel.

headline.print_headline: Missouri: Request To Bolster Mississippi River Is Denied
headline.main: Missouri: Request to Bolster Mississippi River Is Denied

docs.snippet: The Army Corps of Engineers has turned back requests by federal lawmakers and the barge industry to release more water from the Missouri River into the Mississippi....
docs.abstract: Army Corps of Engineers turns back requests by federal lawmakers and barge industry to release more water from Missouri River, believing that drought-starved Mississippi River it feeds will remain open to shipping despite mounting concerns about water levels.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Army Corps of Engineers has turned back requests by federal lawmakers and the barge industry to release more water from the Missouri River into the Mississippi.

headline.print_headline: Illinois: Judge Rules For Workers In Pay Dispute With State
headline.seo: Illinois: Judge Rules for Workers in Pay Dispute With State
headline.main: Illinois: Judge Rules for Workers in Pay Dispute With State

docs.snippet: Gov. Pat Quinn’s administration must eventually pay the 2011 wage increases that were promised to state workers, Judge Richard J. Billik Jr. of Cook County Circuit Court ruled Friday....

keywords.value: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Judge Richard J Billik Jr of Cook County Circuit Court, Ill, rules that Gov Pat Quinn’s administration must eventually pay 2011 wage increases that had been promised to state workers, regardless of whether state budget has enough money.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat Quinn’s administration must eventually pay the 2011 wage increases that were promised to state workers, Judge Richard J. Billik Jr. of Cook County Circuit Court ruled Friday.

headline.seo: Manny Pacquiao Faces a Fight Against Time
headline.main: Pacquiao, Like All Boxers, Is in Fight Against Time

docs.snippet: As he faces Juan Manuel Marquez on Saturday for the fourth time, Manny Pacquiao, 33, may be on the cusp of a moment all boxers experience — the realization that it’s no longer wise to keep going....
docs.abstract: Manny Pacquiao, preparing to face Juan Manuel Marquez for the fourth time, may be on the cusp of a moment all boxers experience--the realization that his career has peaked; Pacquiao, who is 33, has become more consumed with politics and family, and no longer exhibits the unbridled aggression that made him famous years earlier.
docs.lead_paragraph: As he faces Juan Manuel Marquez on Saturday for the fourth time, Manny Pacquiao, 33, may be on the cusp of a moment all boxers experience — the realization that it’s no longer wise to keep going.
